item.title: How BBC visualize data?
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") p_load("tidyverse", "bbplot", "readxl", "viridis", "wesanderson") imdb_tbl <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheEconomist/graphic-detail-data/master/data/2018-11-24_tv-ratings/IMDb_Economist_tv_ratings.csv") imdb_tbl_1 <- imdb_tbl %>% group_by(titleId) %>% mutate(number_season = n()) %>% filter(row_number(titleId) == 1) %>% select(titleId, title, number_season) %>% arrange(desc(number_season)) %>% ungroup() %>% group_by(number_season) %>% mutate(n = n()) %>% filter(row_number() == 1) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(percent = n / sum(n), season = paste0("S", number_season)) %>% arrange(desc(percent)) %>% filter(n >= 15) g <- ggplot(imdb_tbl_1, aes(x = season, y = percent)) + geom_bar( colour = "black", stat = "identity", position = "identity", fill = "orange" ) + geom_hline(yintercept = 0, size = 1, colour = "#333333") + bbc_style() + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) + theme( axis.
